body: I followed the **Docker Compose** tutorial under [https://github.com/doccano/doccano](https://github.com/doccano/doccano)

In my guess, you run `docker-compose -f docker-compose.dev.yaml up` before `docker-compose -f docker-compose.prod.yaml up`. It causes the problem.

Once you run the `docker-compose.dev.yaml`, run `docker-compose -f docker-compose.dev.yaml down` before `docker-compose -f docker-compose.prod up`. We need build and up.

issue.title: unable to use production docker image

labels.name: duplicate
labels.description: This issue or pull request already exists

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
I'm new to doccano and I can't start the application with the **production docker-compose file**, when I follow the guideline in the README.md file.

Following the instructions docs, I cloned today the repo with

`git clone https://github.com/doccano/doccano.git`

Then I created a python virtual environment with python 3.7, activated it, and installed docker-compose in it with
`pip install docker-compose`

Then I ran the container with
`docker-compose -f docker-compose.prod.yml up`

I get no error but then if I follow the guideline of the README.md and go to
[http://0.0.0.0/](http://0.0.0.0/)
(I click on the link in the README.md) then it directs me to
[https://0.0.0.0/](https://0.0.0.0/)
and Firefox displays this message:

> Unable to connect
> Firefox can’t establish a connection to the server at 0.0.0.0.

If I enter in the terminal
`docker ps`
the output is

> CONTAINER ID   IMAGE                  COMMAND                  CREATED      STATUS         PORTS                                                                    NAMES
> 85f0e8659386   rabbitmq:3.8           "docker-entrypoint.s…"   2 days ago   Up 3 minutes   4369/tcp, 5671/tcp, 15691-15692/tcp, 25672/tcp, 0.0.0.0:5672->5672/tcp   doccano_rabbitmq_1
> 051623d73c12   postgres:13.1-alpine   "docker-entrypoint.s…"   2 days ago   Up 3 minutes   5432/tcp                                                                 doccano_postgres_1

and if I run in the terminal

`docker exec doccano_backend_1 pipenv run app/manage.py test api`
The output is

> Error response from daemon: Container 6beea5b4a14ff5c073545764c24dbcb13524be19b15867e474d82d3ffdb0b9d1 is not running

Note that if I go to this address (the one recommended in the dev case):
[http://127.0.0.1:3000/](http://127.0.0.1:3000/)
I get the same message from Firefox:

> Unable to connect
> Firefox can’t establish a connection to the server at 127.0.0.1:3000.

Finally here is the (long) output in the terminal when I enter
`docker-compose -f docker-compose.prod.yml up`

(there seems to be some python file not found and I wonder if there is some implicit step that wasn't in the explanation that I didn't do out of ignorance)

> WARNING: Found orphan containers (doccano_frontend_1) for this project. If you removed or renamed this service in your compose file, you can run this command with the --remove-orphans flag to clean it up.
